citeinfo.origin: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife
citeinfo.title: GISVIEW.MEIFW.SVPBuffers

descript.abstract: This dataset depicts 250-foot habitat zones surrounding the perimeters of Significant Vernal Pools (SVPs) or Potentially Significant Vernal Pools (PSVPs). SVPs and PSVPs were mapped and surveyed in the field by Maine Department of Environmental Protection staff, Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife biologists, and appropriately trained consultants.
descript.purpose: This dataset was developed in accordance with Maine's Natural Resources Protection Act (NRPA). Under this Act, the Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife (MDIFW) is designated as the authority for determining Significant Wildlife Habitats (SWHs). This dataset includes all Significant Vernal Pools currently mapped.

idinfo.accconst: Landowner permission was obtained for surveying all vernal pools depicted in this layer and that were found to qualify as "significant" or "potentially significant" under Maine's Natural Resources Protection Act. The data in this layer are considered public information and therefore available to all users.
idinfo.useconst: Distribution of this data to other users by anyone other than Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife (MDIFW), Maine Deptartment of Environmental Protection, or Maine Office of Geographic Information Systems is NOT authorized. Use of this data for identifying Significant Vernal Pools under Maine's Natural Resources Protection Act is the only use that is endorsed by MDIFW; other uses may or may not be valid.

cntorgp.cntorg: Maine Dept of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

idinfo.datacred: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

attracc.attraccr: Vernal pool outlines are derived from field mapping based on two of the following: USGS Topographic Maps (1:24,000 scale), large-scale aerial photographs, and GPS coordinates. Pool locations are verified by both the field mapper and by Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife (MDIFW) GIS staff and vernal pool biologists. Attribute data for each vernal pool are reviewed by the field surveyor, the MDIFW vernal pool biologist, and MDIFW GIS Staff.

dataqual.logic: Each polygon in this data set represents a single vernal pool with its associated attributes. The "PoolID" field relates the mapped pool to more extensive attributes maintained in a Microsoft Access database. Integrity of the PoolID connection between the spatial and attribute databases is assessed by visual confirmation when each record is created. A hard copy of the field data form used to map and designate each vernal pool is archived at Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife.
dataqual.complete: This data set contains all vernal pools currently designed as "significant" or "potentially significant" under Maine's Natural Resources Protection Act. New pools are being mapped and submitted to Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife for designation on a continuously; this data set is updated as needed based on when new data is obtained.

horizpa.horizpar: Vernal pool locations are mapped from a combination of field mapping based on USGS Topographic Maps, high resolution aerial imagery, and GPS coordinates. The horizontal accuracy is dependant upon which of those data sources were used but should be <10 meters.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Date the pool was entered into the data base and uploaded into this layer at Maine Office of GIS
Name of the Maine Township in which the center point of the pool is located
Designation of the pool under Maine's Natural Resources Protection Act .
Indicates if the pool can be made public (only if landowner permission was obtained for the survey)
UTM east coordinate of the center point of the vernal pool
UTM north coordinate of the center point of the vernal pool
Latitude of the center point of the vernal pool
Longitude of the center point of the vernal pool
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

cntorgp.cntorg: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

cntinfo.cntinst: Send an email or call to request a copy of this data set.

distinfo.distliab: No entity other than Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife, Maine Department of Environmental Protection, or Maine Office of Geographic Information Systems is authorized to distribute this data set.

stdorder.ordering: Call or email to request a digital copy of this data. To save time, download this data as an ESRI shapefile from the Maine Office of GIS public data catalog.

cntorgp.cntorg: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

lineage.Process: SelectLayerByLocation MEIFW.SVPBuffers INTERSECT FSCWOODLOTSHAPEFILE # NEW_SELECTION MEIFW.SVPBuffers
SelectLayerByLocation MEIFW.SVPBuffers INTERSECT FSCWOODLOTSHAPEFILE # NEW_SELECTION MEIFW.SVPBuffers
SelectLayerByLocation MEIFW.SVPBuffers INTERSECT Approximate_Project_Area_Polygon # NEW_SELECTION MEIFW.SVPBuffers
SelectLayerByLocation MEIFW.SVPBuffers INTERSECT Townships # NEW_SELECTION MEIFW.SVPBuffers
SelectLayerByLocation MEIFW.SVPBuffers INTERSECT Indian_Pond_Project_UTM_Meter # NEW_SELECTION MEIFW.SVPBuffers
SelectLayerByLocation MEIFW.SVPBuffers INTERSECT ME_managed_lands_Dec09 # NEW_SELECTION MEIFW.SVPBuffers

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries & Wildlife

dataIdInfo.idPurp: This dataset was developed in accordance with Maine's Natural Resources Protection Act (NRPA). Under this Act, the Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife (MDIFW) is designated as the authority for determining Significant Wildlife Habitats (SWHs). This dataset includes all Significant Vernal Pools currently mapped.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: This dataset depicts 250-foot habitat zones surrounding the perimeters of Significant Vernal Pools (SVPs) or Potentially Significant Vernal Pools (PSVPs). SVPs and PSVPs were mapped and surveyed in the field by Maine Department of Environmental Protection staff, Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife biologists, and appropriately trained consultants.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

Consts.useLimit: Distribution of this data to other users by anyone other than Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife (MDIFW), Maine Deptartment of Environmental Protection, or Maine Office of Geographic Information Systems is NOT authorized. Use of this data for identifying Significant Vernal Pools under Maine's Natural Resources Protection Act is the only use that is endorsed by MDIFW; other uses may or may not be valid.

idPoC.rpOrgName: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries & Wildlife

Consts.useLimit: These data are provided by the Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife to identify candidate significant vernal pools under the Natural Resources Protection Act.
